sinkingstraightlines: It lingers when we're done, you believe God is a woman.
sushmitsuryan: I've found a flaw in the way my hair flows, When I flick my hair, they click photographs , suddenly I am on the flip side, I try to free myself from the sick sanity they have built, They ask me to point at the graph how happy or sad I was, I told them I belong nowhere just now, Same question still appears you wish so desperately for me to choose a side, I'll rather feel fuzzy shaking my head, You don't even know how shaky your reality is, Come to my side and see, I am not so crazy and you not so sane, When I ask you to treat everyone equally and everybody as same, You put shame when I am in my underwear, Under your hair lies a lying mind which goes on rewind to remind me all of that several times, You want me to belong, I want you to accept, Your questions are stuck on my hair, It's really necessary to flip them, I can't lick your tasteless minds, I can't pick your losing sides, I just want to point in every direction, And only my hair works as a sign, Reach for my hair, They change color everyday, I am not changing a bit today, Follow my hair's pointing, Trust me you are already lost.

With closed eyes she seemed like an adorable kitten but Only if you dared to stare deep into her eyes you'd know, what it feels like to be trulty in awe.
imsleepingeatingwanderingolwzz: Holding the colors of ocean and skies...and the depth nd heights in her eyes...💙💙 #redheadwayfarer @redheadwayfarer
my._.dumbass: Things I will never say. Things you'll never know. Things we'll never be. Things. Ha! Such is the materialistic sphere you and I dwell in. Guess what? We have no choice. And the greatest flaw we are a part of is, that we are among people like us to the suffocating limits, yet feel so lonely. Strange how these people have handcuffed us and smashed our mouths with awkward silences. Believe me or not, I am howling inside to say things, only that they fell on deaf ears. Gazing into the horizons of possibilities I often tend to overthink things I wish to say. Only if I could intervene my fingers into yours, struggling hard with the handcuffs, and somehow whisper things to you. And even you would magically cross borders parting us, to intervene your fingers into mine, struggling with the handcuffs, and somehow know things already. Such a colourful mess this world is. Splashes of paint all over the globe. And here we tend to make a difference by remaining black and white. To be or not to be? If this is the question, to our ill fate we black and white hearts have chosen not to be. We could have been so many things yet we chose to be two nothings aspiring to be something. I could have said so much things. You could have known a billion things. We could have been something. But for our choices. Choices to be a part of this colourful mess. Choices to let this colourful mess handcuff us. Choices to not cross the borders and be a colourful mess ourselves. Alas! We made wrong choices. And hence.. Things I will never say. Things you will never know. Things we will never be. Things. @redheadwayfarer ( PS:- You're pyar and inspiration💕)
swatii_b: She was different. Someone who always loved a little more and laughed a little harder. Someone simple. Someone flawsome. Someone broken but someone stronger. She was someone who hoped, someone who believed. Someone who always felt a little lost but someone who held on. Someone who lived with her dreams in her eyes and fought with her demons inside. Someone who cried to sleep but the next morning, someone who always tried. Someone who wasn't complete but was enough. Because she was someone who learned to be her own hero when things got tough. She was someone who just wanted to be free. Someone who simply wanted to live. She was someone who wasn't easy but just a magical chaos within.
